posts.post_content:
[Mountain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mountain) -> [Rite of Flame](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rite of Flame) -> [Exile Simian Spirit Guide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Exile Simian Spirit Guide) -> [Seething Song](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Seething Song) -> [Pyretic Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pyretic Ritual) -> [Desperate Ritual](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Desperate Ritual) -> [Form of the Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Form of the Dragon) as early as turn 1.  
  
My signature deck does that. Don't care how easily I'll die to [Lava Axe](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Axe), [Demystify](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Demystify), [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel), or any of a multitude of cards. 'Cause to me, winning without setting the countryside alight with your very breath isn't really winning.

Posted By: Szyx (3/7/2010 12:02:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ The Swarm:  
  
[Gravity Well](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gravity Well) won't help. When those creatures are declared as attackers, they still have flying. Therefore, declaring them as attackers against you is legal. The fact that they lose flying afterwards doesn't remove them from combat. Now, if you used [Thundercloud Elemental](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Thundercloud Elemental)'s second ability during your opponent's beginning of combat step, yes, his creatures wouldn't be able to attack.
posts.html:
@ The Swarm:

Gravity Well won't help. When those creatures are declared as attackers, they still have flying. Therefore, declaring them as attackers against you is legal. The fact that they lose flying afterwards doesn't remove them from combat. Now, if you used Thundercloud Elemental's second ability during your opponent's beginning of combat step, yes, his creatures wouldn't be able to attack.

posts.post_content:
Wacky Combo..  
  
Step 1... wipe the board of creatures  
Step 2... drop [Witchbane Orb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Witchbane Orb)  
Step 3... [Donate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Donate) this.  
  
If their are no legal creature targets, they would be forced to target themselves and you would win the game. Then again if you had this out and they had no creatures, you still would probably win the game without donating :D  
  
EDIT: I came up with this on my own, but great minds think alike. I see others have posted similar strategies.
posts.html:

Step 1... wipe the board of creatures
Step 2... drop Witchbane Orb
Step 3... Donate this.

If their are no legal creature targets, they would be forced to target themselves and you would win the game. Then again if you had this out and they had no creatures, you still would probably win the game without donating :D

Posted By: shotoku64 (4/10/2012 6:17:07 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@Duriele  
  
Phyrexian Unlife with this is actually better than you say, it's not simply 15 more life.  
  
If you have the 5 lives from this and you're hit during combat for 10 then you'll simply be at -5 lives, if he doesn't hit you more during that turn then you'll get no poison counters and at the end of his turn your life becomes 5 again, gaining 10 life.  
  
So an opponent would have to deal damage to get you to 0 life or less and then deal damage again afterwards within that same turn, to actually cause you any harm.
posts.html:
@Duriele

Phyrexian Unlife with this is actually better than you say, it's not simply 15 more life.

If you have the 5 lives from this and you're hit during combat for 10 then you'll simply be at -5 lives, if he doesn't hit you more during that turn then you'll get no poison counters and at the end of his turn your life becomes 5 again, gaining 10 life.

So an opponent would have to deal damage to get you to 0 life or less and then deal damage again afterwards within that same turn, to actually cause you any harm.

Posted By: Blue_mana (4/9/2012 3:26:54 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As mentioned before, many cards from recent sets have such good synergy with it.   
  
Phrexian Unlife to have one measure of defense against losing right away.  
  
Platinum Angel/Platinum Emperion so you can't lose and your life total doesn't change respectively.  
  
And any of the new cards with Fateful Hour, for not only an extra layer of defense of monsters, but good synergy with your health. Bonus tokens.  
  
All in all, a good card. Wish I had it!
